text: <@U02918BKW>  FYI that whiteboard does not work well (on the z stand) and we'll likely ruin it in this work session.
check
miguel says that the more porous surface requires soapy water to clean, so that would mean we'd outfit a spray bottle and paper towels. i think we should try again with proper resources.
don’t we have rolling white boards? being able to change what’s written without washing the board is kind of key..
i think we have one that is being used in care warroom
but agree on the wash, kat
(especially for client / visitor meetings)
yes we are actively using the rolling whiteboard in copper for care :confused: sorry
abby: all good! i think we'd just benefit from a few more in the studio, but we'll figure that out!

id still like us to try the experience of using the d-school z rack board. its supposed to be a suitable product for both dry erase markers and post-its and we already were using windex to clean the glass boards at water ave. we can declare it a failure once we've tried it as-intended but not before.
<http://dschool-old.stanford.edu/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/dschool_zrack-21.pdf>

Not sure who this should go to, but wanted to bring up a couple of things that came out of our signage meeting today:

1. There's a desire to do something with the hallways with art, maybe mural kind of thing? I know there's a decor and art committee, so <@U13GPDA1F> maybe we can connect on that?

2. This one is more of a question - what is going on with the niche in the hallway of the third floor currently housing odds and ends? Hoping for there to be a purpose and if there is, who is working on it? We'd like to make sure it's moving forward and presenting a good image of Uncorked as guests walk in.

totally. and re: the niche - this likely falls under the decor piece too, but maybe with some tour component <@U2DTF0B6Y> is working on. ive always seen that as more of an evolving product or employee showcase space, but that hasn't been thought through yet (at least by me)
Ok good to know, in that case wondering if we move the stuff that's in there now?
im not sure who put that there / who to check with :upside_down_face:
<@U02918BKW> any insight?
isnt that nook the one that <@U3M4RRNQ5> is working on? they are building in nook seating?
those are the nooks, we’re talking about the niche :slightly_smiling_face:
the big long horizontal cutout that leads down the hallway on 3
hi, the niche is serving as a temporary offset to the lack of a countertop in the prototype lab. once we get that equipment settled we can repatriate their knickknacks.
Ok thanks John, that's helpful.
Sorry, yeah, the nooks can't be built out until we have CO, they'll require footers to be built and we can't have them in before inspection.

Re: niche, I am in agreement with Lynsey that the niche should showcase our products , uncorked as a product, or individuals work in a curated rotating exhibit when things feel stale. Perhaps Part of an arts/decor committee - we should have a big picture conversation with <@U0265G76F> about the niche . It is a great showcase and talking piece for the tour depending on the audience and how we tell the story of our work.
